meanings.definition: A person or thing that curses.
meanings.sent1: The cursers in the movie scared me with their bad words.
meanings.sent2: The town was afraid of the cursers who brought bad luck.
meanings.sent3: The little dog barked at the cursers, trying to protect its family.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed like cursers, bringing a storm of angry words.
meanings.sent5: The old book warned of evil cursers lurking in the shadows.

meanings.definition: Plural form of the verb 'curser', meaning to utter offensive words.
meanings.sent1: The group of cursers at the party made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The cursers on the street were shouting loudly at each other.
meanings.sent3: The cursers in the comedy show made the audience laugh with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: The cursers in the debate were like swords, cutting through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The cursers in the game chat were quickly reported for their bad language.
